metadata.title: CVE-2021-24031 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Zstandard command-line utility prior to v1.4.1, output files werecreated with default permissions. Correct file permissions (matching theinput) would only be set at completion time. Output files could thereforebe readable or writable to unintended parties.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24031` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzstd1 - 1.4.8+dfsg-1
zstd - 1.4.8+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libzstd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.8+dfsg-1').
